New Records: Will Smith's seven postseason homers the most by a catcher in franchise history
Key Match Events: Mookie Betts hit a first-inning home run for the second night in a row
Will Smith hit a two-run homer off Bryan Hoeing in the third inning
Gavin Lux hit a two-run homer off Wandy Peralta in the second inning
Tommy Edman executed a rare safety squeeze in the top of the seventh inning to score Max Muncy and extend the Dodgers' lead to 6-0
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said before the game that the team is not scared of the moment and has a 'win or go home' mentality
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers are ready for Game 5, but with this series so compelling, you can't blame anyone for wishing it was a best-of-seven
The Dodgers have confidence that Shohei Ohtani can put on a show just as he did all year
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers will have $1 billion in free agents on center stage Friday alone with Shohei Ohtani and Yoshinobu Yamamoto, hoping they can live up to all of the hype in the biggest game of their major-league careers
The Dodgers are facing the Padres starter Dylan Cease for the third time in two weeks, never giving him a chance to settle in while pitching on short rest
Others: Freddie Freeman was scratched an hour before the game started with his sore right ankle, and shortstop Miguel Rojas was still hobbled after leaving Game 3
The Dodgers' lineup was re-organized with Max Muncy moving from third base to first, Enrique Hernandez from center field to left field, and insert Chris Taylor in center
